result.execSummary:
The defendant Sydney L Borden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Cash bail applied to fine. Balance to be paid in 90 days or penalty of 7 days jail for non-payment.

Case 15CM2401 was dismissed and read in.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sydney L Borden

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Ponath.
WCS treatment status report dated 5/12/16

Attorney Sarah A Ponath in court.   Defendant Sydney L Borden did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend Count #2 to county ordinance disorderly conduct.  Attorney Ponath enters a guilty plea to amended charge.  Court finds Defendant guilty of amended charge and imposes fine of $367.50 - to be paid in 90 days, alternate 7 days jail if not paid.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.
Cover letter dated 05/10/16, filed by Atty Ponath.
Authorization to appear received and filed by Atty Ponath.
Dated 05/11/16, from ACC.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 05-12-2016 01:30 pm
letter from Alliance Counseling Center and WCS pretrial program report.

Defendant Sydney L Borden in court with Attorney Sarah A Ponath.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ponath provides some counseling documentation.  Attorney Ponath requests a plea and sentence date in May, 2016.  Court adjourns.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Dated 02/23/16, from ACC.

(Fax) from Attorney Ponath requesting court to advance cost of medical records.

2/11/16 - Court grants Atty Ponath's request to advance the cost of producing the requested medical records in the amount of $169.76.
Hearing at 03-01-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Sydney L Borden in court with attorney Sarah A Ponath.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ponath requests an adjournment as she has just received discovery and Defendant wishes to pursue counseling.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing at 01-08-2016 09:30 am
Atty Ponath has been appointed. Defendant to pay: $50/month commencing on 01/04/15.
Hearing at 01-08-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Sydney L Borden in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states she did not qualify for public defender representation.  Defendant requests a court appointed attorney.  Court reviews petition and grants request.  Defendant to pay for such counsel at rate of $50.00 per month, commencing 1/4/16.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 12-01-2015 08:30 am
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with  Brandon H. and Jasinta H. victims listed in the criminal complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Sydney L Borden in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
